entry.def: You use would when you are saying what someone believed, hoped, or expected to happen or be the case.
entry.tran: (表示曾经相信、希望或期待)将，将会

example.ex: No one believed he would actually kill himself...
example.tran: 没有人相信他真的会自杀。

example.ex: Would he always be like this?…
example.tran: 他会一直是这个样子吗？

entry.def: You use would when saying what someone intended to do.
entry.tran: (表示曾经打算)将，将会

example.ex: The statement added that although there were a number of differing views, these would be discussed by both sides...
example.tran: 这项声明还称，虽然双方观点存在若干分歧，但将就这些分歧展开讨论。

example.ex: George decided it was such a rare car that he would only use it for a few shows...
example.tran: 乔治认为这辆车非常稀罕，所以他只会拿它展示很少的几次。

entry.def: You use would when you are referring to the result or effect of a possible situation.
entry.tran: (表示可能出现的情况的结果或影响)会，将会

example.ex: Ordinarily it would be fun to be taken to fabulous restaurants...
example.tran: 一般来说，跟别人去豪华餐馆吃饭会是件乐事。

example.ex: It would be wrong to suggest that police officers were not annoyed by acts of indecency...
example.tran: 要是认为警官对粗鄙行为不气不恼，那可就错了。

entry.def: You use would, or would have with a past participle, to indicate that you are assuming or guessing that something is true, because you have good reasons for thinking it.
entry.tran: (would 或 would have 与过去分词连用，表示有充分理由认为或猜测是某种情况)肯定，一定，应该

example.ex: You wouldn't know him...
example.tran: 你肯定不认识他。

example.ex: His fans would already be familiar with Caroline...
example.tran: 他的崇拜者们肯定已经很熟悉卡罗琳了。

entry.def: You use would in the main clause of some 'if' and 'unless' sentences to indicate something you consider to be fairly unlikely to happen.
entry.tran: (用于if，unless等引导的条件状语从句的主句，表示认为某事不大可能发生)就，该

example.ex: If only I could get some sleep, I would be able to cope...
example.tran: 要是我能睡会儿，我就能够应付。

example.ex: I think if I went to look at more gardens, I would be better on planning and designing them...
example.tran: 我觉得如果我更多地去看一些花园,就有可能更好地规划和设计它们。

entry.def: You use would to say that someone was willing to do something. You use would not to indicate that they refused to do something.
entry.tran: 肯;愿意

example.ex: They said they would give the police their full cooperation...
example.tran: 他们说他们愿意与警方通力合作。

example.ex: She indicated that she would help her husband...
example.tran: 她表示愿意帮助她丈夫。

entry.def: You use would not to indicate that something did not happen, often in spite of a lot of effort.
entry.tran: (表示尽管付出很大努力却没有发生)就(不)，偏(不)

example.ex: He kicked, pushed, and hurled his shoulder at the door. It wouldn't open...
example.tran: 他冲着门又踢又推，还用肩膀撞，但门就是打不开。

example.ex: He kept trying to start the car and the battery got flatter and flatter, until it wouldn't turn the engine at all...
example.tran: 他反复试着发动车子，但电池的电越来越少，最后根本就打不着火了。

entry.def: You use would, especially with 'like', 'love', and 'wish', when saying that someone wants to do or have a particular thing or wants a particular thing to happen.
entry.tran: (尤与like, love 和 wish 连用，表示想做某事或拥有某物，或希望某事发生)要，会

example.ex: She asked me what I would like to do and mentioned a particular job...
example.tran: 她问我想干什么，然后提到了一份工作。

example.ex: Right now, your mom would like a cup of coffee...
example.tran: 你妈妈现在想喝一杯咖啡。

entry.def: You use would with 'if' clauses in questions when you are asking for permission to do something.
entry.tran: (用于带if从句的疑问句中，表示请求许可做某事)会

example.ex: Do you think it would be all right if I smoked?...
example.tran: 我可以抽烟吗？

example.ex: Mr. Cutler, would you mind if I asked a question?
example.tran: 卡特勒先生，我可以问您个问题吗？

entry.def: You use would, usually in questions with 'like', when you are making a polite offer or invitation.
entry.tran: (通常在疑问句中与 like 连用，表示礼貌地给予或邀请)

example.ex: Would you like a drink?...
example.tran: 想喝一杯吗?

example.ex: Would you like to stay?...
example.tran: 您愿意留下来吗?

entry.def: You use would, usually in questions, when you are politely asking someone to do something.
entry.tran: (通常用于疑问句中，表示礼貌地请求某人做某事)请

example.ex: Would you do me a favour and get rid of this letter I've just received?...
example.tran: 请帮个忙把我刚刚收到的这封信处理掉行吗?

example.ex: Would you come in here a moment, please?...
example.tran: 请进来一下好吗?

entry.def: You say that someone would do something when it is typical of them and you are critical of it. You emphasize the word would when you use it in this way.
entry.tran: (用于批评，表示对某人做某事并不感到意外，此时 would 须重读)

example.ex: Well, you would say that: you're a man...
example.tran: 呵，你当然会这样说的，因为你是个男的。

example.ex: 'Well, then Francesca turned round and said, That's a stupid question.' — 'She would, wouldn't she.'
example.tran: “嗯，接着弗朗西丝卡转过身说，这个问题问得真蠢。”——“她肯定会这么说，不是吗？”

entry.def: You use would, or sometimes would have with a past participle, when you are expressing your opinion about something or seeing if people agree with you, especially when you are uncertain about what you are saying.
entry.tran: (would 或 would have 与过去分词连用，表示发表看法或了解他人是否赞同自己的看法，尤用于对自己的话没有把握时)

example.ex: I think you'd agree he's a very respected columnist...
example.tran: 我想你得承认他是个备受尊敬的专栏作家。

example.ex: I would have thought it a proper job for the Army to fight rebellion...
example.tran: 我会认为派军队去平叛是恰当之举。

entry.def: You use I would when you are giving someone advice in an informal way.
entry.tran: (用于以随便的口气向人提出建议)我(就)会

example.ex: If I were you I would simply ring your friend's bell and ask for your bike back...
example.tran: 如果我是你,我就会直接去按你朋友的门铃, 把自行车要回来。

example.ex: I would not, if I were you, be inclined to discuss private business with the landlady...
example.tran: 我要是你，就不会跟房东太太谈私事。

entry.def: You use you would in negative sentences with verbs such as 'guess' and 'know' when you want to say that something is not obvious, especially something surprising.
entry.tran: (用于否定句，与 guess, know 等动词连用，表示某事不明显，尤用于某事令人吃惊时)

example.ex: Chris is so full of artistic temperament you'd never think she was the daughter of a banker...
example.tran: 克丽丝极富艺术气质，你根本想不到她是银行家的女儿。

example.ex: Inside, he admits, his emotions may be churning, but you would never guess it.
example.tran: 他承认，内心里他可能心潮起伏，但你根本不会猜到。

entry.def: You use would to talk about something which happened regularly in the past but which no longer happens.
entry.tran: (表示某事过去惯常发生, 而现在不再发生了)就，会

example.ex: Sunday mornings my mother would bake. I'd stand by the fridge and help...
example.tran: 星期天早晨，妈妈会烤面包，我就站在冰箱旁帮忙。

example.ex: 'Beauty is only skin deep,' my mother would say.
example.tran: “美是肤浅的。”妈妈会说。

entry.def: You use would have with a past participle when you are saying what was likely to have happened by a particular time.
entry.tran: (would have 与过去分词连用，表示某个时间前可能发生的事情)就，会

example.ex: Within ten weeks of the introduction, 34 million people would have been reached by our television commercials.
example.tran: 在推出10周之内，可能会有3,400万人看到我们的电视广告。

entry.def: You use would have with a past participle when you are referring to the result or effect of a possible event in the past.
entry.tran: (would have 与过去分词连用，表示过去可能发生的事情的结果或影响)就，会

example.ex: My daughter would have been 17 this week if she had lived...
example.tran: 我女儿要是还活着的话，这周就17岁了。

example.ex: If I had known how he felt, I would never have let him adopt those children...
example.tran: 我要是知道他的想法，我是决不会让他领养那些孩子的。

entry.def: If you say that someone would have liked or preferred something, you mean that they wanted to do it or have it but were unable to.
entry.tran: 原想;本来想

example.ex: I would have liked a life in politics...
example.tran: 我本想从政的。

example.ex: She would have liked to ask questions, but he had moved on to another topic...
example.tran: 她本想问问题，但他又继续谈另一个话题去了。

entry.def: You use would, usually in negative sentences, to criticize something that someone has done and to express your disapproval of it.
entry.tran: (通常用于否定句，批评某人所为，表示不满)（不）会

example.ex: I would never have done what they did.
example.tran: 他们做的事情我是决不会做的。

entry.def: If you say 'would that' something were the case, you are saying that you wish it were the case.
entry.tran: 但愿

example.ex: Would that he could have listened to his father.
example.tran: 他要是听了他父亲的话就好了。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个词均含"过去惯常，过去总是"之意。
means: used to ： 指客观地表示过去的习惯，既可是过去经常发生的动作，又可是过去一向存在的状态，比would通俗，往往含今昔感。
would ： 指过去经常发生的行为，主观感情色彩较浓，只表过去惯常行为，既不表状态也不表持续动作。不含"过去如此，现在不再这样"的意味。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wolde, past of wyllan (see will)
